docs.snippet: A former Facebook operations manager told a British parliamentary committee on Wednesday that data harvesting of member profiles by outside software developers was once routine and that the company took years to clamp down on the practice.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Took Years to Clamp Down on Developers' Data Harvesting: Ex-Operations Manager
headline.main: Facebook Took Years to Clamp Down on Developers' Data Harvesting: Ex-Operations Manager

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know about the week’s top stories.

headline.main: Gun Control, John Bolton, Facebook: Your Weekend Briefing

docs.snippet: Authorities in the U.S. and the U.K. are bearing down on Facebook and political data-mining firm Cambridge Analytica over allegations the firm stole data from 50 million Facebook users and used it to manipulate elections.

headline.print_headline: At a Glance: Calls in US, UK to Probe Facebook, Data Firm
headline.main: At a Glance: Calls in US, UK to Probe Facebook, Data Firm

docs.snippet: British privacy regulators are seeking a warrant to search the offices of the political consultancy Cambridge Analytica late Monday following reports that the company may have improperly gained access to data on 50 million Facebook users, accordin...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Under Pressure as U.S., EU Urge Probes of Data Practices
headline.main: Facebook Under Pressure as U.S., EU Urge Probes of Data Practices

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump wants Americans' privacy to be protected and welcomes investigations into reports the Cambridge Analytica consulting firm that he hired to help win the 2016 U.S. election improperly used personal data of 50 million Facebook ...

headline.print_headline: White House Welcomes Looks Into Reports Trump's Consultants Misused Facebook Data: Official
headline.main: White House Welcomes Looks Into Reports Trump's Consultants Misused Facebook Data: Official

headline.main: Facebook, John Dowd, Syria: Your Thursday Evening Briefing

docs.snippet: Republican Senator John Kennedy has joined his Democratic colleague Amy Klobuchar in calling on Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to testify before Congress following reports that a political consultancy gained inappropriate access to d...

headline.print_headline: Republican Senator Joins Call for Facebook CEO to Testify About Data Use
headline.main: Republican Senator Joins Call for Facebook CEO to Testify About Data Use

docs.snippet: Big internet companies and small software developers alike are likely to face scrutiny over how they share customer information in the wake of the scandal involving Facebook Inc and the British election consulting firm Cambridge Analytica.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Scandal Could Push Other Tech Companies to Tighten Data Sharing
headline.main: Facebook Scandal Could Push Other Tech Companies to Tighten Data Sharing

docs.snippet: Colbert lamented the fact that a Trump-linked data firm collected private information on millions of Facebook users.

headline.print_headline: Stephen Colbert Would Have Liked a Facebook Alert About Cambridge Analytica
headline.main: Stephen Colbert Would Have Liked a Facebook Alert About Cambridge Analytica

docs.snippet: Hun Sen, the longest-ruling leader in Asia, has turned his back on Western aid and tightened his grip on Cambodia, with the blessings of Beijing.

headline.print_headline: Cambodia’s Ruler Tightens Grip, Energized by Beijing’s Blessings
headline.main: Embracing China, Facebook and Himself, Cambodia’s Ruler Digs In
